1122146408197447680.text: He’s right.  My life has improved dramatically. @RyanHoliday @dailystoichttps://twitter.com/dailystoic/status/1121531249099563008 …

1123263414598537216.text: How Damian Lillard turned ‘bad shots’ into good ones - with a little help from @RyanHoliday and stoicism.https://wapo.st/2vzGrVj

1121832862322315264.text: “A man when he has done a good act, does not call out for others to come and see, but he goes on to another act, as a vine goes on to produce again the grapes in season.” Marcus Aurelius

1123284336621568001.text: “Remember, it is not enough to be hit or insulted to be harmed, you must believe that you are being harmed. If someone succeeds in provoking you, realize that your mind is complicit in the provocation." - Epictetus

1121875994824982528.text: "Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances." Viktor Frankl

1122950910072840192.text:
.@RyanHoliday discusses his favorite Marcus Aurelius quote:

To learn more about Stoicism and how to apply its lessons to your life subscribe to our YouTube channel. Visit:

https://www.youtube.com/dailystoic?sub_confirmation=1 …pic.twitter.com/jStVBtn3ON

1122639775062581248.text: "If you learn that someone is speaking ill of you, don’t try to defend yourself against the rumours; respond instead with, ‘Yes, and he doesn’t know the half of it, because he could have said more.’" Epictetus

1122261054925369344.text: "The tranquility that comes when you stop caring what they say. Or think, or do. Only what you do." Marcus Aurelius

1121797348521177088.text: “Remember how long you’ve been putting this off…that there is a limit to the time assigned you, and if you don’t use it to free yourself it will be gone and will never return.” Marcus Aurelius

1122527245635993600.text: "For we are naturally disposed to admire more than anything else the man who shows fortitude in adversity." Seneca

1121531249099563008.text:
Ryan Holiday's Favorite Stoic Quote

Watch Here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SJjUSt4DIws …

1121572267664658432.text: "Blame no one. Set people straight, if you can. If not, just repair the damage. And suppose you can't do that either. Then when does blaming people get you? No pointless actions." Marcus Aurelius

1123288333189140480.text: “Forget everything else. Keep hold of this alone and remember it: Each of us lives only now, this brief instant. The rest has been lived already, or is impossible to see.” Marcus Aurelius

1123002486007009280.text: “You act like mortals in all that you fear, and like immortals in all that you desire.” Seneca

1122218435050524672.text: “It is not external events themselves that cause us distress, but the way in which we think about them...It is our attitudes and reactions that give us trouble. We cannot choose our external circumstances, but we can always choose how we respond to them.” Epictetus

1121482603566002176.text: "Another person will not hurt you without your cooperation. You are hurt the moment you believe yourself to be." Epictetus

1122585302105608193.text: “We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more in imagination than in reality.” Senecapic.twitter.com/8nDShDj0Nx

1122904224109682690.text:
Why Your Own Death Should Be Your Biggest Motivation

with @RyanHolidayhttps://youtu.be/zl1x9fA89S8

1122173909258760192.text: “I prefer to do right and get no thanks than to do wrong and receive no punishment.” Cato the Elder
